primary_indicator.name: Ranking Uplift
primary_indicator.description: The most important analysis for a reranker is the change (uplift or drop) in ranking metrics like NDCG@k or MRR from before to after its execution. This comparison will be handled by the Synthesis Agent. Your primary role is to evaluate the final ranking quality.

final_ranking_quality.name: Final Ranking Quality
final_ranking_quality.description: These scores reflect the quality of the final, re-ordered list of documents sent to the generator.

scoring_tiers.interpretation: The reranker is successfully and consistently promoting the most relevant documents to the very top.
This indicates a solid and effective ordering of the context.
This score suggests the reranker is not very effective.

critical_weakness: If you are able to infer that a final ranking score is lower than the initial retriever's ranking score, you must flag this as a severe pipeline failure, as the reranker is actively harming performance.
